characters: DUMPING OF MANURE... IN EX-HUSBAND'S CAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white sun beats down on the rocky terrain. There's no cloud in the blue sky and the wind is at a standstill. Far in the distance, a MEDIUM SIZED FLAT-BED TRUCK makes way to the entrance of a large cavern opening. Two VULTUR perched on a barren tree watch the intruders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck screeches to a dusty stop. Three men in matchin coveralls and hard hats jump from the cab: CHIEF (42, sto weary), LANKY (32, withered) and COLLEGE BOY (23, clean c and naive). Chief holds a map and glares into the howling black mouth before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did it have to be these caves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to College Boy) Don't mind me, buddy. It's nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief grabs a flashlight and moves to the back of the tru The logo on the rear gate reads "WIGWAM WASTE MANAGEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get that first barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gate drops revealing their full load of YELLOW BARREL bearing the familiar BIOHAZARD WASTE symbol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College Boy and Lanky steer a cart loaded with the first  barrel inside. Chief's lone beam of light leads the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the awkward silence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College Boy shakes his head "no" and they set the cart do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last winter, a man kidnapped a little  girl and holed up in one of these  caves. The cops had him pinned down  and began to move in. This guy started  shooting... but he wasn't aiming at  the officers... (getting closer) ...he was firing at something inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College Boy is rapt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the dust cleared, all they found  was the little girl's shoes. (beat) With the feet still in 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something GRABS College Boy's ankles, causing him to jump

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lanky's on his knees, having grabbed him from behind. The two men mockingly laugh. College boy settles, embarrassed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, relax, I nearly shit myself  when my boss pulled that one on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went well beyond nearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a sound. All eyes turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once was plenty, fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chief moves forward, pulling out his pick-axe. Instantly, the cave is illuminated by a white floodlight. group of GREENPEACE HIPPIE ACTIVISTS stand in the cave,  CHAINED TOGETHER at the waist, startling the men into scr MEAN GREEN (35, crooked glasses on a face that has launch a thousand craps) barks into a MINI BULLHORN that hangs a her neck. She charges towards Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it right there! You will not  rape Mother Nature one more day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, Chief drops his pick-axe and stumbles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In unison, the hippies start CHANTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Nature is not a whore/Don't  dump in her any-more/Mother Nature  is not a whore/Don't dump in her any- more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BEARDED CAMERAMAN with a huge KEY RING on his belt, fil the whole event. The three men are stopped in their track

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy! We have a permit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing a document) And we have an injunction from the  State to prevent any dumping in these  caverns! This is virgin land! The  aqueducts in these caves bring  drinking water to our families, and  its piping provides drainage for our  farms that enrich this barren land!  And it won't be tainted by waste of  any kind! Not now! Not ever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, shaken, confirms the injunction and hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, just back off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps his fingers, motioning to the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's roll... Now-now-now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backing away, looking to Mean Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you guys always know where  we're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smirk) I'll tell ya next time! NOW MOVE IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hastily, the men roll the barrel out of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Score one for the green team!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hippies let out a spirited cheer. One pulls out a  tambourine, drums the beat for KUM BI YA. The rest join i the victorious chant as they watch the three men hop in t truck and peel away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, that was righteous, but I  need a shot with the sign up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the human chain, an earthy woman, FUZZY, mo to hang a GREENPEACE sign. Mean Green strokes the cave wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saved you today, ol' gal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuzzy hammers the sign in, but hits too hard, causing a b in the rock wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister, why do you always swing for  the fences?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing breach) It's okay, but I... I think I see  something in there... something shiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuzzy puts her face up to the hole for a closer look. The rest of the hippie-chain moves in closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my, it looks like diamonds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHOMP! A set of giant, ravenous teeth bite into Fuzzy's s Blood SPLATTERS on the hippies. Bearded Cameraman jumps to pull Fuzzy from the breach. Fuzzy's body is YANKED into the hole. The group tumbles  forward. Mean Green tries to stop herself from sliding, but can't. One by one, the hippies are being dragged to their death. Ripping, tearing, and howling echoes off the walls. Bearded Cameraman stumbles back. Mean Green spots him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the keys!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bearded Camerman just stares at her in shock. He's missin both his arms. Mean Green lunges and grabs Chief's dropped pick-axe. She HAMMERS at the chain around her waist. Foot by foot, she's dragged closer. At the last second, s BREAKS the chain, popping herself free. She spins, running for safety. A guttural HOWL behind her fills the cavern. Mean Green sprints toward the cave open She's gonna make it. Only a few more feet. And then... JE Something grabs her neck and YANKS her back into the dark The whiplash sends her bloody BULLHORN flying into the li As it lands, it lets out one last weak HONK...

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSED
dialogues.text: The title SHATTERS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - We frantically EMERGE from the burning wreck...  RUN from the crash over desolate prairie land...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neon light flashes UNITED NATIONS TAVERN. Laughing and mu emanates. Besides the bar, there's nothing around for mil A 1985, pristine black Pontiac Trans-Am with a Golden Eag on the hood pulls up. The rear bumper sticker reads "MY O

dialogues.speaker: TOY HAS TITS."
dialogues.text: A weasel-like man with a fat belly and tank-top emerges f the hot rod carrying a VELVET POOL CUE CASE. Freeze on hi

dialogues.speaker: LIFE EXPECTANCY
dialogues.text: The rest of the parking lot is scattered with cars and pi trucks. Bozo lazily makes his way to the bar and pushes  through the front entrance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo passes a man dressed in a cheap suit and standing we over six foot five with frazzled black hair and olive ski Talking with a thick Greek accent, he pleads into a pay p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into pay phone) They took my laptop with my PowerPoint  presentation, my Blackberry, my  cell... And to top it off, my car  crapped out on the side of the road!  I'm not making the conference and I  have fourteen leads waiting for me.  You gotta help me out here. I'm not  kidding, I've have fourteen PRIMO  leads waiting in the lobby of the  Mariott... MARIOTT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze on him.

dialogues.speaker: AGE
dialogues.text: OCCUPATION: LIFE COACH & MOTIVATIONAL SPEAKER

dialogues.speaker: LIFE EXPECTANCY
dialogues.text: CLICK. The pay phone goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a -- (deep breath, soothing) In with anger, out with love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further into the bar, a man in a wheelchair loads a quart into an old jukebox, but he is instantly pushed away by B Freeze on him.

dialogues.speaker: LIFE EXPECTANCY
dialogues.text: Bozo's tank-top reads, "ONLY COOL CHICKS CAN DO ME."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling away) Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, fag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo punches in his selection. EDGY CAT (34, samurai pony tail, don't you dare call him an alcoholic) stands by the bar's POOL TABLE powdering his cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bozo) You're late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't dilly-dally then. Rack 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CD spins and an 1980s heavy metal classic KICKS IN. Bozo, mouthing the lyrics, struts away. NOTE: Music plays over all the bar sequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - We continue to run. Rapid breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer Guy (kinda handsome... just kinda) sets a keg of bee behind the bar. Freeze on him.

dialogues.speaker: BOTH
dialogues.text: He talks with BARTENDER (thinning hair, chiseled face, bi earring) who preps a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, we'd been together for so  long and then... bang! She drops me.  Since then, it's been like a damn  country song: she's gone, the car's  repossessed, and a father figure  made a pass at me. I'm not saying I  ever had it. But I have definitely  lost it. (beat) Now I haul this swill from armpit to  armpit. I used to be a model for  Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach has been eavesdropping on Beer Guy and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what, may I ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JC Penny. Spring wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer Guy then mimics throwing a sport coat over his shoul and delivering his "model" cheese smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Chach, catching you at  this low point is pure serendipity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I take the rubble of man and  build superstars. In my briefcase  here is a doorway to a self-help  sensation. Give me a minute, because  I'd like to buy you a drink and change  your life forever. I have a brochure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it. We don't deal in pamphlets  'round here. We stick to chemistry.  And his drinks are on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender puts a shot in front of Beer Guy. Behind him, a mounted DEER HEAD is prominently displayed. Freeze on him

dialogues.speaker: LIFE EXPECTANCY
dialogues.text: With Coach stumped, Bartender turns to Beer Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that the last keg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup, one keg of Beast for the  basement, then the truck's dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're stayin', move the truck,  boss gets pissed about you using  primo parking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer Guy downs his shot and hoists the lone keg into the  waiting keg elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, 'cause this joint's hopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a button and the keg slowly lowers to the basemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - We jump over a bush and crash in the dusty earth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass of beer slides down the bar. A hand GRABS it and  puts it on a tray. The woman is pretty though haggard, st apron and dirty blond hair. Freeze on her.

dialogues.speaker: LIFE EXPECTANCY
dialogues.text: Tuffy carries the tray toward a table. She passes a TV mo on the wall. ON TV: A NEWSCASTER, dressed in a coat and tie, talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the search for the missing  protesters will be further complicated  by the unstable conditions of these  deep tunnels. Thus far, no sign of  life has been detected, yet town  officials are still optimistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newscaster spins and an ECLIPSE GRAPHIC appears on screen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a brighter note, or should I say  a darker note, tomorrow's solar  eclipse will bring out adults and  children alike for a citywide fair  of this metrological event. Stay  tuned for our man on the street to  take a closer look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer Guy pulls the keg from the elevator and places it ne to other kegs. A faint conversation brews behind a curtai BOSS MAN (paunchy, sweaty, ugly) and ROADIE (English acce light hair, leather skin, thin build) talk shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, bud. I got a load ready to  move and your man's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming. Relax. And if he doesn't  show --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - We are trucking... labored breathing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy moves to a table where ADULTERER (bushy mustache,  sweater vest, dress shirt) sits with TRAMPY (designer gla hair pulled back, tight blue business suit, closet tramp) Freeze on Trampy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said there was no reason I had to  stay a teller and that if I did good  work and didn't mess up, I could  become an assistant manager within  three years. (pause) Can you believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze on him.

dialogues.speaker: LIFE EXPECTANCY
dialogues.text: Adulterer reaches into his pocket to pay the tab, but he  inadvertently pulls out his hidden WEDDING RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like bullshit! I could  be an assistant manager at The Lake  Arrowhead Casino for knowing the  fuckin' alphabet to G! I'll be twenty  in three months...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The damning wedding band falls and bounces. As it rolls,  Tuffy, Trampy and Adulterer watch. The ring stops, standing still on its side. Trampy seethes as she chooses which obscenity to deliver. Adulterer slides a wad of cash to Tuffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just bring the whole bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - Sprinting and wheezing. The bar lights are ahead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy walks back over to the bar adding Adulterer's cash a fat roll of money. BELLE (stringy blond hair, cute face brand-spanking new employee) looks up with surprise. Freeze on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could made that kind of money,  I'd be in Hollywood next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man walks by and nods to Tuffy, making his way to th rickety side-staircase to the SECOND FLOOR. Tuffy grinds teeth and moves to the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Round here, there are ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man winks at Belle. Pure sleaze. Freeze on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - Running, approaching the distant bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo looks grimly at a pile of CASH on the ledge of the p table. Edgy Cat sinks the eighth shot of a NINE BALL game

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That cash is gonna look much better  in my pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: mounted head) Ya know, that deer only looks scared  when you're in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para rolls up behind Edgy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgy looks to Para, distracted. Bozo quickly replaces the WHITE CUE BALL with one hidden in his waistline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - The bar's a quarter mile away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para's chair back aims at the pool table pocket of which  Edgy Cat is lining up for the winning shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all she wrote...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMACK! The nine ball sinks in the pocket, the cue ball  ricochets away as intended. Para flips a switch under his wheelchair's arm rest. The ball strays ODDLY into the pocket near Para. Scratch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh, now that's a rough one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's motherfuckin' impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crude Oriental accent) Yoh anga will be yoh downfah. Go  again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. Crape Diem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo takes the cash from the table. Edgy Cat sulks away  cursing to himself and moves to the bar. Roadie looks on, sipping a beer. Freeze on Roadie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - Still running. The bar is getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo HITS the table of GRANDPA (elderly, white hair, bush white mustache) and GRANDMA (curly white hair, glasses). Freeze on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up! Check your pants!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking) What's that? Wha'cha say? Huh? (to Grandma) How much for the whole night, Grandma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be so lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: his fists) This one will stun ya, but this one  will put ya to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo approaches OLD VET (52, long hair with bandanna, dir beard) HARLEY MOM, (45, bruiser, grizzled, tough as a sad and DRUNK GUY at the bar. The sad trio toss peanut shells into three nearby tall, fat peanut barrels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys wanna try your luck at the  loot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harley mom is offended. Not a word from the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'll even throw with my  left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns in disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' but a bunch of butts and  pussies in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - The bar is close -- we leap a ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRASH! Belle DROPS a tray full of drinks behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Shit! Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sweat it, just clean it up  before he's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points up to the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy's son CODY (7, innocent, cute) sits on the floor  watching TV. Freeze on him.

dialogues.speaker: LIFE EXPECTANCY
dialogues.text: Tuffy puts headphones over his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep these on, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, I want Nemo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy's working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy kisses him and then moves to an adjacent room.

dialogues.speaker: ADJACENT ROOM
dialogues.text: Tuffy enters the room and takes off her blouse exposing h breasts. She pulls up her skirt and bends over a bedpost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man walks up naked, except for red cowboy boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love a woman with enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo walks to the middle of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got two hundred bucks says none of  you can beat me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Get quiet or get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon guys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - Hurtling toward the double doors and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme some ACTION --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! The double doors to the bar are kicked open by HERO (30s, rugged alpha man built to kick ass). KRASH! Belle DROPS a second tray of drinks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hero is scraped, bruised and bloodied. He is dressed in b denim and holds a RUST-RED SHOTGUN and GUNNY SACK. He SLAMS the double doors shut and props a chair against handles, securing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you people want to die you'll  do what I say and you'll do it fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender cocks his SHOTGUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hold it right there, mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A storm of hell's coming down on  this place any minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the canon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hero puts down the shotgun and moves towards Bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not armed now, just hear me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drop you and not even think  about it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me explain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got one second to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hero reveals a drool-dripping, white, GRANDPA BEAST HEAD  from the gunny sack and holds it out and for all to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a good look and listen to me!  There's at least a four of these  things out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa Beast's head has large red eyeballs and a mouth f of jagged, ivory white teeth. It is like an albino jackal head with spiked hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw one of them tear up five men  like they were corn on the cob! (off silence, shock) I don't know what they are. I don't  know where they came from. All I do  know is that these fuckers are fast,  nasty, and hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar stares at him, slack-jawed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they can fly. Not to mention  they got claws like Ginsu knifes and  more teeth than a chainsaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender lowers his shotgun slightly. Fast as a snak Hero GRABS it. He notices the engraving, "THE JUDGE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're like goddamn blood hungry  biker tattoos come to life. They're  clocking us. Right now. And we have  to lock this bar down! (moving around) That means doors, windows, drains,  and basements. We have to do it fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hero looks out the lone front window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks to Belle) You! Get on that phone. Call the  cops, National Guard, townies, whoever  kicks ass and get 'em out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle moves to a pay phone at the end of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the hero --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! A white Beast arms BURSTS through the window and S Hero right down the middle. The Judge FIRES into the ceil

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: The Judge's blast blows a toe off Boss Man's RIGHT FOOT a he reaches climax with Tuffy. Boss Man HOLLERS.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: Hero's right half is JERKED outside through the window. Blood sprays. Rapid chomping. CRASH! The double doors are kicked open, splintering the propped up chair. HEROINE (Native American, rugged, ripped pants, wickedly  hot) rushes in, slams the doors shut and instinctively ki up the RUST RED SHOTGUN. She flips it sideways and slides the metal weapon through the handles of the double doors, securing them. BAM! A massive HIT slams into the doors from the outside  sending Heroine SLIDING across the floor. She SPRINGS to her feet and drives her weight into a tabl attempting to hoist it over the now open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELP ME! SOMEBODY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Vet and Harley Mom rush to Heroine's aid. They raise table to cover the gaping hole. Heroine looks outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BEAST nails the rising table, just missing Heroine's fa The table falls, pinning Heroine. JUNIOR BEAST enters. He's small and too fast to see well. He SWIPES the heads off Old Vet and Harley Mom. Bartender grabs The Judge, but he's SCRATCHED down the back. Junior Beast rips out the pay phone. Knocks over the TV. Yanks out half of Trampy's hair. Edgy Cat CHARGES the spastic monster with a stool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgy Cat misses. Junior Beast sends him FLYING into a wal BLAM! BLAM! Bartender FIRES The Judge at the creature hit lights instead. An errant shot destroys Edgy Cat's face. Para covers as Junior Beast RIPS the back of his wheelcha Roadie WHACKS Junior Beast with a chair. Stunned, it flie across the room, landing in a metal ICE COOLER. Bozo SLAMS it closed, capturing Junior Beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got 'cha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadows of THREE SHRIEKING BEASTS close in on the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender runs across the bar and SLAMS shut the thick wo shutters. The Beasts HIT, cracking the middle. Roadie power lifts the table with Heroine and braces it  against the window for reinforcement, but a FURRY ARM bus through and grabs the other half of Hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood starts to SPRAY from outside as the rest of Hero is being devoured through the smallish hole. Heroine works a GOLD RING off of Hero's ring finger. The  feeding MOMMA BEAST'S head breaks in through the hole. It grabs Heroine's left forearm. Bartender aims The Judge at the Beast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll hit her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie KNOCKS The Judge up -- BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: The Judge's shotgun blast blows off another toe on Boss M RIGHT FOOT. He cries out in agony.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: Heroine spins and buries a splintered piece of the broken chair into the ATTACKING MOMMA BEAST'S RIGHT EYE. The Bea SCREECHES and jerks back, dragging the rest of Hero outsi Heroine clutches the ring. Shrieks and flapping wings are heard outside. They dissipate. A moment of calm. Belle timidly holds the receiver of the busted pay phone. The other patrons emerge from under tables and other hidi spaces in various states of shock. Junior Beast has  momentarily stopped moving. Bozo secures the lid with a n PADLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the FUCK was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wild-eyed and with a trembling hand, Heroine pours hersel shot from the bar. She downs it and takes a long breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jungle has a new king.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pan and scan over various NEWSPAPER HEADINGS with picture and newsreel footage that read:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a HOLLER at the top of the stairs. Everyone turn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it clear?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a gun pointing at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I got the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man hobbles down the stairs with the help of Tuffy. foot is a bloody mess. He is holding a .38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright goddamn it! Who shot me!?  Who did it!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle and Bartender move to his aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goddamn foot is gone! Who fuckin'  shot me? Who fuckin' shot me!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning to Heroine) Her fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where's the sonuvabitch!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (noticing destruction) What the hell happened down here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man looks to Bozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do it! It was fuckin'  monsters, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ on the cross... someone  make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy. We're surrounded by something  the likes none of you have ever seen  before. Some kind of animals. Real  fast, volatile, predators. One went  through three of your patrons like  nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, your dead hubby shot me twice,  three of my customers have been eaten,  and there are angry creatures outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He only shot you once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Bartender) He shot you the other time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man squints skeptically. Adulterer points to GRANDPA BEAST'S HEAD on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fan-fuckin-tastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god... what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one piece of four problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please elaborate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That head over there, that's the  oldest of the bunch, looked like the  Grandpa. We caught the little one,  Junior, in the cooler there. As we've  seen, what he lacks in size he more  than makes up for in speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the rest of 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, the worst of 'em are  still outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOTE: As Heroine describes each beast, we see a slight gl of their virtues, hidden mainly by shadows and fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next one is taller, but all out  of proportion. Like a "teen beast."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEEN BEAST has a big head and awkward body. He clumsily m and seems uncomfortable in his own skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was spastic, clumsy, but deadly  just the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine tends to her scratched arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just took the eye out of the mother.  She calculates, guiding the attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOMMA BEAST flashes out from the dark. She's shorter than Teen, but much wider. She has a big mouth and NATIONAL  GEOGRAPHIC BOOBS that hang down to her waist. She covers stabbed right eye and SCREECHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine taps her right eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are face to face with her,  dive left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the last one is the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father. The biggest, the strongest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blur of muscles, bloody fur, and teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire bar stares at Heroine with their mouths agape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of any weaknesses. No sign  at all. He's an eating machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the friggin' bars to be stuck  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not it. Four are here, but  there's three others... which I can't  account for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine eyes the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to lock this place down. Is  everyone in this room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god! My son! My SON!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy races toward the staircase to the SECOND FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy is halfway up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cody! Mommy's coming! Mommy's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Tuffy BURSTS through the door. Cody sits by the TV, unmov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy pulls Cody into her arms. Heroine and Bartender hal to guard the doorway. Heroine spots a SMALL PORTAL WINDOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sweetheart! What was I thinking?  Mommy is never gonna let you go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's lock off this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving to exit) Never, ever, never. Never, ever,  never, baby. I love you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH! Papa Beast BURSTS through the portal window and RI Cody's torso from Tuffy's grasp. Tuffy holds his DANGLING ARMS. Blood sprays everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa Beast LUNGES at Tuffy! Bartender SHOOTS, nailing Pap Beast. He hisses, but can't fit through the small window. Bartender aims again for a kill shot, but Papa Beast  projectile vomits Cody's remains at Bartender. Papa Beast retracts out the portal window. Heroine SLAMS wood shutters closed. Tuffy drops Cody's arms. Bug-eyed. She moves, zombie-like to the staircase. Bartender follows, covered in Papa Beas bile. Heroine locks the staircase door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: Beer Guy stares at the bile covered Bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands him a towel. Tuffy slowly walks towards the rest the patrons. The blood on her face and chest tells them w happened. The horror hits home. Heroine eyes the destroyed phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tuffy) Are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine puts a hand up to silence Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let her be... please. (beat) Is that the only phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender emerges from the back holding a mess of plastic and wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back phone is wrecked, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trampy's eyes light up and she digs through her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is really happening. I can't  believe this is really happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa and Grandma have calmly re-taken their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender hesitantly tosses a wash towel over the Grandpa Beast head at the end of the bar. Para is awkwardly trying to fix the back of his wheelchai Belle moves over to help and sees a mess of wires coming  from the wheelchair's back rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, but I don't need any help --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? A power magnet or  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle puts together his scam with a smirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't peg you for a con man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it pays more than the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of stuff around here does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trampy pulls out a CELLULAR PHONE from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group looks over. Adulterer GRABS it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer Guy walks from behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what now? Did those things leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go check it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) I have a signal! I have -- Diane?  Diane listen to me... get the kids  and get in the basement... do it  right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trampy stares with grief in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll explain later. Not now! I'm at  a bar... look... shut up! JUST SHUT  UP AND GET IN THE FUCKING BASEMENT,  DIANE! Diane! Diane?... Hello? Damn  it! I lost the signal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer looks at the phone a bit dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. Look now, I gotta get  outta here! I gotta go! My wife...  See my wife is alone... She could be  in trouble. I GOTTA GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves towards the front door. Heroine moves into his p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer, violently grabs Heroine to shove her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine nails Adulterer with THREE HITS to the chin, thro and chest, flipping him to the floor. She pulls a KNIFE f her belt buckle and has it under Adulterer's chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can risk your life, but not mine!  My daughter's no more than twenty  miles from here waiting for me. I  have just as much reason to leave  this place as you do. But I also  know that if they're here, then  they're not there yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer squirms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand me!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now pull that tough boy shit again  and I'll slice you from neck to nuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer nods obediently. Heroine removes the knife from his neck and plants it back into her buckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't keep me here. This is  bullshit. Fuckin' bullshit. This is  fucking BULLSHIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't risk letting them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling, pissed) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer takes his seat. He looks over at the half bald  Trampy. She looks at him, hurt. At the bar, Bozo puts the TV back into place, he jiggles  with some wires in the back, bringing back the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar takes notice. Trampy, cell phone in hand, paws th a phone book as she watches the broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See! This has to be isolated. That's  a local broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TV: The Newscaster reads the teleprompter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, we head to our man on the  scene with a live look at tomorrow's  event in Red Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine eagerly looks on, moving closer to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter's in Red Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TV: There is an awkward pause from the Newscaster. The broadcast doesn't cut to the reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear us? Apparently we're  having some technical difficulties...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine sinks in her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there we go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TV: A REPORTER, in an even worse suit, stands in a fie with several people looking through telescopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, the crowds are lining  up early to witness tomorrow's  meteorological phenomenon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine sighs a gust of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But always remember, don't look  straight into the sun because a  special filter is needed to avoid  damaging your cornea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reporter beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're all looking forward to it  tomorrow. Back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the studio, the Newscaster smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. And in other news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie points to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That studio's local, we can call in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a short wave radio upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trampy is already dialing on the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling them... it's ringing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd have a police scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell) Hello? Yes, we're at the United --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TV: the Newscaster continues his routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it has been reported that the  power outage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Beast arm REACHES in and TEARS off Newscaster's jaw. Th bar gasps in horror as his blood sprays. ZAP! The broadca cuts out, turning to static. Trampy screams and DROPS the cell, SHATTERING on impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! Oh fucking no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine, tense, quells the rising panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it together! I came from the  east. That studio is south of here.  For all we know, north and west are  okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An associate of mine was coming in  from the north, ain't heard a word  from him in hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, that leaves the west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy looks up from a booth, clearing her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Red Mountain. Your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine looks over, making eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is goddamn depressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the door, Heroine slides a thick metal pole through th double door handles and takes out the Rust Red shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got some tools and extra planks  in the kitchen, if we're on the same  page here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last board is hammered into place as the survivors ba away from the now re-enforced bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll it ain't pretty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But its got teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM-BAM-BAM! Junior Beast bangs around in the ice cooler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's hungry again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to kill it. (to Boss Man) Can you help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man hobbles over to the cooler and aims his .38. Jun Beast goes wild, trying to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire in the hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets rip through the cooler. Junior squeals. More shot Casings hit the ground. Smoke rises. Bozo leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we got --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAH! A tiny white arm fires out from the cooler GRABBING  Bozo's leg. Bozo yelps. Moving quick, Tuffy grabs The Judge from Bartender and sh the barrel into a hole. BLAM! Guts splatter. Bozo falls back unscathed. He catche his breath and looks to Tuffy. She is born again, seethin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands the shotgun back to Bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, it took all that? All those  bullets? How can we possibly fight  off the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aim for their orifices. Eyes, ears  and mouth. From what I've seen, it's  their only weakness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the corpse) Looks like they're soft on the inside  like any other animal. Trick is to  get in there and do the damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we don't have to fight them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, let's just call 'em names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach steps forward, poised to make the sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, if I may have  your attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar skeptically eyes the large, sweaty Greek man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to think outside the box  here. We don't need to fight them,  we need to scare them. Scare them  right back. This is a species stand- off. We just need to show them we're  not vulnerable. That we're formidable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender opens the cooler's lid and carefully pulls out  Junior Beast with salad tongs. It falls to the floor with SPLAT. Coach grabs a splintered broomstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He buries the broomstick into Junior's side and carries t limp carcass towards a covered hole in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get that board down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie pries off a board to reveal a pumpkin sized hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach shoves Junior's mangled body through to the outside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing superiority. The scent of  their dead may drive them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole bar moves to the side wall to see how the Beast family will react. They look through SMALL HOLES, barely  able to see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Come onnnnnn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a call, or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that you monkey fucks! That's  what you get when you mess with us!  Woman or man, I don't give a fuck!  Shit don't make me gay because you'll  be sucking my dick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo's insult hangs in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet...

dialogues.speaker: P.O.V
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! Junior is swiped from the handmade pike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach jerks back. The startled group tries to focus, but  it's too dark outside. With the moon as the only light, F Beast can barely be made out cradling his dead child. Silhouettes of the other family members slowly approach  Junior. Papa Beast is gentle and it's almost endearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's working. I think it's working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? What I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole group starts to ease. Then... Papa Beast HOLLER

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SMALL HOLES
dialogues.text: Papa Beast lets out a HORRID WAIL. The group jumps back,  covering their ears. Then, something really odd happens. Momma tosses Junior in the air, opens her wide jaws and  SWALLOWS HIM WHOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good christ! They're cannibals!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SMALL HOLES
dialogues.text: Papa Beast moves behind Momma Beast and grabs hold of her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steady "thud-thud-thud" rhythm vibrates the bar. Grandp drink starts to hop to edge of his table with the beats. group maneuvers to get a better look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... my... god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing now?

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SMALL HOLES
dialogues.text: Yes, Momma Beast and Papa Beast are having MONSTER SEX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, they're humpin'!

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SMALL HOLES
dialogues.text: Unlike humans, Papa Beast finishes and the birth cycle la all of thirty seconds. Momma Beast's belly balloons up an she squats. POP! A SLIMY OBJECT the size and shape of a v cleaner drops from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trampy VOMITS.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SMALL HOLES
dialogues.text: The slimy object SPLITS in half. The two halves spring  appendages and raise their heads. The TWIN SISTER BEASTS  have been born. Papa moves forward and cleans off his new baby girls. The Beast Girls look at the bar and hiss in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine's eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM-SLAM! The two hissing Beast Girls strike the bar fro Roadie shoves that board back over the hole. Beer Guy is  holding back the still heaving Trampy's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any more ideas, Animal Planet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I-I was just being proactive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bozo) Hey, you weren't helpin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go douche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're stuck in here. That's what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo pops open a beer off the back of Para's wheelchair. Roadie nods to Grandpapa Beast's head on the end of the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't mind me asking, how did  you run into these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More importantly, how did you run  away from these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it all started about forty  hours ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The orange sun melts into the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hero and his overweight friend TUBBS (35, hard living car farm hand) laugh at a TV show while Heroine paces on the  telephone in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) So, how is staying with Grandma  working out? Ya know, if you stare  into her glasses, you can see what  cards she is holding. But I didn't  tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a home on the horizon with a big barn next to it. Shrieking and flapping grows in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine starts to peek out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy will pick you up tomorrow night,  okay baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone cuts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine and Hero look at each other with concern. Hero lo out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy mother of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine has the group mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We barricaded ourselves in the cellar.  Then it was just listening. We heard  those things destroy an entire heard  of livestock. They just kept coming.  Closer and closer, consuming anything  in the way. Slashing, feeding and  licking the bones clean. Just when  we said our prayers, the first ray  of sun hit the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLOP! A HORSE'S HEAD falls as Heroine and her companions  peek out from the damaged cellar door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That first beam of sunlight drove  'em away. Somewhere. We called who  we could and then decided to run for  it. We didn't see a soul the whole  drive out. When the tank went dry,  we came upon a gas station to refill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is falling into the horizon. The traveler's CAMAR pulls into a small gas station

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine goes up to the service window with Tubbs and look inside. Nobody. There is a slight BUZZING from inside. Hero hollers from the fuel pump by the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on? The pumps are off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows the buzzing sound to a corner of the room. Th is a swarm of black flies crawling over half a STATION  ATTENDANT'S gutted torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn on the pump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass shatters as Heroine reaches inside to turn on the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had no time. All we knew was the  sun was dropping and we had to get  enough fuel to make it through the  night at 90 miles per hour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hero fills their Camaro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck it down you metal bitch. Suck  it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine and Tubbs hastily grabs food and drinks, ignoring the cash register completely. The sun is setting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hero turns as a shrill HISSING comes from the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happened fast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine and Tubbs emerge from the gas station shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine and Tubbs hear the growing cries of the Beasts. Their loot hits the pavement as they run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hero drops the spilling gas nozzle. Tubbs slides into the back as Heroine jumps into the driver's seat. Hero runs over the top of the Camaro and slides into the  sunroof. He grabs a rifle and aims toward the leaking gas pool. Something rises in the gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when I saw three others...  just for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three lean, muscular shapes rise from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine fires up the car and tears out. Hero shoots and t station becomes a FIREBALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hero lowers into the back seat and starts to close the ro as STRIPPED COUSIN BEAST lands on top of the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stripped Cousin Beast PUNCHES through the back window,  reaching for them. Heroine jerks the wheel. The car 180's and the Beast sails off of the car into  darkness. The Camaro tears down a tangent dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hero reaches back to give a "five" to Tubbs. Tubbs doesn' respond. Heroine is the first to see Tubbs' quivering,  HEADLESS body in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine stands near Grandpa Beast's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must have smelled the blood or  something. We buried the body and  got back on the main road when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Grandpa Beast LANDS on the front hood of the Camaro Heroine and Hero SCREAM and rev the engine, swerving madl as Grandpa Beast VOMITS on the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine slams on the breaks. Grandpa Beast slides back,  holding onto the grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa Beast tears into the engine through the grill as  sparks and smoke shoot out. Heroine jerks the steering wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's how I ended up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car crashes into a ditch, DECAPITATING Grandpa Beast. His head FIRES through the windshield, landing on Heroine lap. Its snake-like tongue lashes out at Heroine's crotch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, your husband ditched you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was wild out there. No time  to think. We just moved. He didn't  leave me. He just ran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, justice is funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para wheels over to a COUNTY MAP on the side wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three from the gas pump are over  at the TV station? And you say there's  four here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's five here now, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Heroine) Hey, you lived on a farm, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they're gone? I haven't  heard anything for a while, maybe  they're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe they migrate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as it's dark, they're around.  They hide, wait for you to drop your  guard, and then attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be so sure? You said  yourself this started a day ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We learned fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We? We learned fast? You are all  that is left of we. No offense  Pocohantas, but I think someone else  should play "Chief" tonight. Someone  that knows the lay of the land. (beat) Like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para stares intently at the map. Adulterer moves over to window that has shutters over it, peeking through a hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe these things are like locusts  or something and only come out for a  few days to feed. This could just be  a part of their life cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's gotta know something about  these things. This stuff just doesn't  happen out of the blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is silent. Bozo looks around, quickly moving tow Grandpa and Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta know somethin', you're  old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old people know stuff like this.  Legends, tall tales, shit like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spill it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Grandma) How 'bout you? Or do I have to get  rough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavens no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Think back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I throw a stick, will you go away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just horse shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, they don't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... allegedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo saunters off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Heroine) Hey, where was your farm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to map) East. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever slaughter? Slaughter  livestock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Previous owners did, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slaughterhouse run-off used to be  drained into piping that ran through  the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para points along the map as he explains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earthquakes often cracked the piping  and those flow lines were condemned,  but never drained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheese n' rice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I am saying is... there's a  distinct possibility that what we  are up against is the result of steady  stream of blood and tissue that has  been leaking into the caves. And a  day ago... something broke out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first order of business is gettin'  a big fuckin' tampon in that cave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, that wouldn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM ADULTERER'S P.O.V. - He peeks out the hole and sees  nothing but the dark night. Bartender eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're probably on to the next buffet  by now. There's a retirement home up  the road, they'd be easy pickings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Adulterer) Careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, I don't see a thing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOINK! Papa Beast's claw POKES into his eye. Adulterer JE away holding his blood squirting eye socket.

dialogues.speaker: FROM OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - The eye sees its owner stumble back and fall to  the floor holding his face.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Coach and Trampy move to help Adulterer.

dialogues.speaker: FROM OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The eyeball fires into Papa's drooling mega-mouth. SLURP!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: BASH! A Beast arm BURSTS through the side wall and SNAGS  Coach's pants and boxers. He screams and lunges forward. is BOTTOMLESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stay in the middle of the  room! Off the walls! NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone obeys her command to get in the middle of the ro Belle hands Coach a little menu to cover himself with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, does everyone agree that they  are still out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bozo) 'Eh, Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trampy holds Adulterer's wounded head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know some first aid if we have a  kit. Do we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen, under the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one goes anywhere alone. Least of  all, unarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Coach) There's some sweats in my bag behind  the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach heads to the bar. Roadie moves to the map near Para

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a clever man. (re: Bozo) Why do you take shit from him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's an ass, but he's my  brother. Que sera-sera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look man, I read books. He reads  bumper stickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie nods. Heroine jerks a bottle of booze from Beer Gu and tosses it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, we need to stay alert and  for everyone to take a role. (to Boss Man) You gotta have some guns or weapons  around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man, pale and morphine pumped, sits at a table with foot raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my .38 here. That's six shots  and two refills. Downstairs, I have  locker with a sawed-off and some  gardening tools. Maybe a few boxes  of shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got shells, too. Box and a half  tops. Machete behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well that's something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we've got guns, kitchen knives,  pipes, fire and sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer Guy scans the stocked bar wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might be able to do something with  the bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna need a whole lot more  than that to get outta here alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd turns to face Grandpa and his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, now you have something to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa holds on to Grandma's hand as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You young'uns worry about weapons,  I'm thinkin' 'bout strategy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? And what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit still, look less like a meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for bears and sharks, chunky  chew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group looks back to Heroine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, what else do we have? Can  we somehow contact the outside world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trampy pensively stays on her fractured phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get anybody. I don't even  know if I have a signal anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a CB in my truck, we could  get some help out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell would you call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you drive a short beer bus or  something? You go out there, you get  eaten. You stay in here, you get  eaten. Anyone comes to help, they  get eaten. Don't you see a pattern  here, Spuds Makenzie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess we should just give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Trampy) Believe me, I'd love to save the day  and get some heroic snatch, but it's  not in the cards, partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Boss Man) You said you had a short wave radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it. It's by the far wall.  Channel 9 is the emergency frequency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm heading to the basement  for supplies. (to Bozo) And you're going upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo blinks. A little taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not get carried away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step up, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's how it is? (hands out) Fine! Shotgun, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender hands him The Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bartender) You're coming with, portly. 'Cause  if I'm attacked, I want a fat man  close by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now who else is comin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one budges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising from his seat) I'll go with ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? Throw your  teeth at 'em? Sit down, Cocoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender moves to the back of the bar, grabbing his mach At the same moment, Coach emerges from behind the bar in  very snug, feminine-looking pink sweat pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! Zorba! You're coming too! (to Heroine) Now gimme the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine tosses the keys to Bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're locked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those two will be on the other side  waiting for you. If you become food,  I don't want the only set of keys in  the belly of one of those things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get your hopes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo moves to the staircase. There's blood at the bottom it gets worse with each step. Bartender and Coach follow. Heroine turns to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any volunteers to head into the  basement with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy stands, sniffling. She wipes the tears from her eye looking tough and resolute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what happened upstairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Shut your mouth. You have  no idea what is running through me  right now. No idea. (to Heroine) I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine, Tuffy, Roadie, and Beer Guy all move to the base The door creaks open slowly. The group descends.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Bozo slightly slips on the blood. He grips the railing an pulls himself up the staircase like an old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright you two, I don't want to  hear any of this, "oh, I dropped the  key, wrong key, ain't no key here."  When I want out, I want out, ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (displaying keys) They're right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got your back, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They unlock the door, swinging it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep 'em handy, ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender has the key in the thick dead bolt, ready to mo

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Bozo hustles in. The door shuts and locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish me luck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Bozo is on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay! I'm okay!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Bozo rises and nervously surveys the damaged floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo jumps when he sees the gore and the bloody shoes fro Cody's attack. The TV illuminates the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geeezzzus. (moving gingerly) Okay, now. Easy steps. Easy breaths.  Easy steps.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: Belle kneels next to the Boss Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you holding up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a bottle out of his pocket and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morphine. My magic potion. I need a  few drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts a few drops on his out-stretched tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should try a little, it'll calm  your nerves. Works like a charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No other time than now, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, before you do that, help me  move. There's a small room off the  kitchen where I can lay down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's much safer in there. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: BASEMENT
dialogues.text: The basement is dark, dingy and scattered with crap. Drie out ANIMAL CARCASSES hang from the ceiling on hooks. A WI is open. Roadie slams it shut, eyeing the room, staring i the dark corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on your toes everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy tightly grips her weapon, ready to fire. Heroine kn next to a hatch door that emits a red glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie jams a pipe into the little door, bracing it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to know what that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer Guy finds the dusty locker and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a sawed-off shotgun in here.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Bartender and Coach have their ears pressed to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, through a boarded window, something CRAWLS  upward.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Bozo moves turtle slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamaze. Lamaze. Lamaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the Boss Man's private room. He puts his hand out to open it. Trembling, he touches the knob and... CREEEEEEEEAK! The door eases open. Bozo steps inside the  room. He moves over to a lamp and pulls the chain. A bat  FLIES off the lamp shade SCREECHING. Bozo falls backwards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAAAA!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Bartender and Coach jump back.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Bozo gets off the floor again. He may have filled his pan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a bat! I'm okay! Just a bat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he doesn't shut up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is human kabob.

dialogues.speaker: SMALL ROOM OFF KITCHEN
dialogues.text: The room is like a converted pantry. Boss Man lies on a c kissing Belle. A tiny wall fan spins providing ventilatio Belle pulls away and brushes back her long hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't your foot hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't feel a thing, Hon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching his crotch) How 'bout now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bad girl, aren't you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle, a bit high, sways and starts to remove her clothes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um-hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl's got rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off her blouse and tosses it at him. She then l up her skirt and bends over, giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
