dialogues.text: There it is.

dialogues.speaker: BASEMENT
dialogues.text: Roadie emerges with two crates. He dumps them on the floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer Guy holds a rusted machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could come in handy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get everything upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine moves to the stairs, but stops. She grabs Tuffy b the arm and takes her aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm fine. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admire your strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I plan on having a full  breakdown when this is over, but for  now, we all have to be strong, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine reaches into her shirt and pulls out an IDENTICAL LOCKET as Tuffy's. She opens it and displays a picture of LITTLE GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my daughter, Charlie. She's  all I'm after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting back tears) Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm gonna need your strength,  every bit of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. But still do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a wink) Don't tell anyone I have a soft side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tiny smile) Deal.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Bozo turns and points the gun around the room. He sees th CB. It is like an intercom with a cable running outside. drops the shotgun and fidgets with the CB knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Anyone there? We need help  out here at the United Nations Tavern.  Send guns, tanks, and all that shit.  10-4. S.O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he gets is static. A faint GROWL is heard outside. OU THE DOOR Bartender hears the growl, his eyes grow wide.

dialogues.speaker: SMALL ROOM OFF KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Belle rubs her hands over her rounded ass and flicks her  tongue at Boss Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna see, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much I got, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you got to see the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand, sweety. Daddy  doesn't pay. Daddy sees the show for  free. But you do get points for being  horny on a night like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cringes and backs up a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't expect a man to buy a car  without a test drive first, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, hmm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wiggle that sweet little ass  over here and sit on Daddy's face, I  wanna do some appraising.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Bozo barks into the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat. We need help. SOS. Calling  all cars! Calling all cars! We need  help at the United Nations Tav --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CB is JERKED from Bozo's hands and slams into the wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo aims the gun at the wall. Chewing sounds begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs up to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm ready to come out now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender confidently turns the key. CLICK! It breaks off the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "OH!?" WHAT IS "OH?" What does "oh"  mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo knocks on the door hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY! OPEN IT!!!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Bartender looks to Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN THE DOOR!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thunderous CRASH! Boards fly off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SMALL ROOM OFF KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Belle, hearing the crash, jerks back from Boss Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! Sister Beast #1 and Sister Beast #2 punch through tiny wall fan and GRAB Belle by the scalp. She is JERKED  against the wall. She's slammed against it repeatedly and then -- RIP! Bell skin is TORN from her head and torso. Boss Man jumps back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoh-SHIT! Help!! Help me!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle falls into Boss Man's arms for a HIDEOUS KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! NO! NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man shoves the bloody Belle back against the wall. Sister Beast #1 pokes her head inside the room, hissing.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: Heroine and the others, just returning from the basement, hear the mayhem from upstairs and the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Coach fumbles desperately with the jammed lock, trying to use his fingernails to turn the metal stump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great god, why do you damn me?!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Bozo bangs on the door and looks over his shoulder at the Momma and Papa Beast chomping at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET ME OUTTA HERE!!!

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: The group is mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please, no.

dialogues.speaker: SMALL ROOM OFF KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Boss Man uses the cot to block the Sister Beasts from  entering. They hiss and shred the cot fabric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're getting in! Somebody help!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Bozo kicks and punches the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELP!!! GODDAMN IT!!!

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: Heroine charges up the staircase. Roadie rips the sawed-o weapon from Beer Guy and runs for the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key broke off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Coach) Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine rips the earring from Bartender's ear. He YELPS. jams the backing into the lock.

dialogues.speaker: SMALL ROOM OFF KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Boss Man crawls for the door. Sister Beast #1 fires out a whip-like tongue and snags Boss Man's damaged foot. He ho in pain. Sister Beast #2 tongue-lasso's his other foot.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Heroine's picking fingers are bleeding from her effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELP ME PLEASE!!!

dialogues.speaker: SMALL ROOM OFF KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Boss Man is pulled towards the Sister Beasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELLLLLP!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie kicks open the door and FIRES at the Sisters. They dive back out of the room screeching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELLLLLLLLP!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right behind Bozo, the boards fly off the portal window. Papa Beast flies at Bozo. Bozo spins and aimlessly FIRES shotgun, hitting Papa Beast directly in the groin. The door flies open. Bozo is YANKED to safety just as Pap STRIKES the closing door.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: The patrons track the wild CRASHING and HIGH-PITCHED SHRI sounds of Papa Beast. He finally breaks out of the upstai Beer Guy and Roadie carry Boss Man into the room as Coach Bartender, Heroine and the shaken Bozo creep down the sta Bozo slowly takes a seat in his brother's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was it for a second  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got Papa in the stones. (beat) He's neutered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... good one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That back room is sealed shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine glares at Boss Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to stay in the main room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I will. I will. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach eyes the group, this is his time to shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising, full of brawn) If they can't reproduce anymore --  we are one step closer! A big step!  Now is the time to band together. We  need to rise up against these monsters  of the night! Those creatures are no  match for the human spirit! We can  do it! We just need to believe in  each other! In all of us! We need to  make a stand! Right here! Right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long silence. Bozo stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, are you gay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach sits down, humbled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know what not to do. We must stay  focused and together. The beasts  will find a breach. We gotta find a  way out before they find a way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's run for the cars, cause mass  confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lot's too damn far, that's  surefire suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is silent. Bartender motions to Boss Man, but he promptly shushed by Boss Man. Heroine notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Boss Man) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Roadie) You. What was that door downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine glares at Roadie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bullshit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie nods, causing Boss Man to sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It runs about a hundred yards and  spits out on the backside of that  hill down the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clam up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it for!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grass, man. I grow pot down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does the tunnel spit out near a car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It spits out behind the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My truck is near, but it ain't nearly  big enough to haul the whole lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shot. Is it gassed up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many can it hold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna fit thirteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirteen clowns wouldn't fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with hand out) Keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you planning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three of us go. Two to defend, one  to drive. We back up to the bar and  then tear ass out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds sketchy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me make this clear; if we stay,  we die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man reluctantly pulls out some keys that are on a st around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give 'em to me, I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trusting that con? He'll ditch  us and never look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I'm not trusting him either,  that's why I'm going with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach stands forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Courage is being scared to death,  but saddling up anyway." (off blank stares) The Duke. I will go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. They have this place  surrounded, but if we go under them  we might just make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a bottleneck waiting to  happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMACK! Bozo SLAPS Coach's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's great under pressure. I  wish you luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of you prepare the weapons,  whatever you got left. 'Cause when  we crash through those walls, we're  bringin' death with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine takes The Judge from Bartender and hands it to Co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't believe in guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't time for a political  stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach takes the rusty machete from Beer Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't run out of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine, Roadie, and Coach move to the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three look to Bozo, who offers a parting nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you get to that truck... drive  it like you stole it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a booth, Trampy re-bandages Adulterer's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lousy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still have one left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the silver lining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It serves you right for cheating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure it's karma. You wronged me  and you wronged your wife, so this  is karma biting you on the ass, or  in your case... in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo moves close, surveying the bandage work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be worse, you could be dead.  Then again, the climax is upon us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Trampy's hair) Ya know, that's not a bad look on  you. Kinda 1985, but not bad. I'd  hook it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't fuck you for practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, cyclops. Let's have a quiet  contest... starting now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo turns his attention back to Trampy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya know, in situations of duress, I  have found that women are attracted  to my authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine, Roadie, and Coach make their way through the  basement. Creeks and cracks with every step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Heroine) You handle yourself pretty well. You  a cop or a criminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither. Just a farmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Then how do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think about my husband and  daughter... and the rest is easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light casts a shadow of something BEHIND THE CURTAIN. Roadie moves to open the curtain with his sawed-off barre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP! The curtain slides. It's a dried animal hide on a h They all sigh. Roadie unblocks the tiny door. Heroine scans the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is creepy in the daytime,  too. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach's hand shakes as he raises his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. I fight monsters all  the time. (gripping the door) On three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie, Heroine raise their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... two... three!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie whips open the door. Nothing. BANG-GONG-GONG! Some pipes CRASH to the ground next to th they jump, but nothing is there. A LITTLE MOUSE emerges f the fallen heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach leans down and puts out his hand. He smiles as Hero watches over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, little fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves the mouse and follows Heroine to the tunnel. SLURP! A pink tongue LASSOS the mouse. A red fluorescent glow radiates from the tunnel. They all drop in, one by one, entering the steamy, confined space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a brothel for plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhhhhhhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy stands by a far wall, looking through the planks fo movement. At the bar, Beer Guy makes MOLOTOV COCKTAILS. Bozo moves close, slaps Beer Guy's constructing hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah-ah-ah! You're doing that all wrong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're doing it wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo grabs a cloth rag and moves to the alcohol bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move aside, princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tunnel is thin and no more than SIX FEET HIGH. Cherry red fluorescent lights line the top of the tunnel and kne marijuana plants are along the ground soil. There are thi pipes above the plants that work as a makeshift watering  system. There is about six inches of water on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Roadie) You and I are similar. We both have  accents. We both travel a lot. We  both don't really have homes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry, I ramble when I'm nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach bites his lip, dying to say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that this seems like the  opportune time for someone to be  horribly... offed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm done now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo stuffs the cloth rag into one of the bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want the rag touching booze,  that way you can hold it and ensure  it explodes when you throw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? I thought the rag had to  touch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo finishes the Molotov cocktail and grabs a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfecto. What we should do, though,  is put those peanut barrels to use.  Fill 'em with booze and line up some  planks. If the walls come down... we  hit 'em Donkey Kong style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para and Beer Guy eye the three large peanut barrels, per for bomb-making.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aren't nearly as dumb as you  look, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, look within. Stereotyping  can be ugly and hurtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo looks to Trampy, putting an arm around her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for being forward, but I'm  curious about your dimensions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie leads the way and glares at the opposite end. The  tunnel slightly curves, so he can't see the whole way dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up. You hear something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCRATCHING sound is heard from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to burrow through the  tunnel walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scratching sound increases, now heard from the far en of the tunnel as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like moles these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, Sister Beast #1 drops into the tunnel from the far  end. She charges. At the last second, Roadie spots her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie and Coach duck into the water, but Heroine is unab to avoid a thrust that knocks her back ten yards. Sister  Beast #1 lands and turns, surveying her prey. Roadie aims his water-dripping gun, but Heroine rises and blocks his  shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From her knees, Heroine fires. BLAM-BLAM-BLAM! The three  shots push Sister Beast #1 backwards. Heroine rises, cove in muddy water and bleeding from a cut across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! The bitch is mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie and Coach reluctantly turn, leaving Heroine to fen with the Beast. Heroine charges. Hissing, Sister Beast #1 charges as well Heroine pumps and fires. BOOM! Sister Beast spins, avoidi the shot. Now too close, Heroine jams the Beast in the mo with the gun, knocking her back. Sister Beast #1 responds with a swipe and chomp on the ar Heroine bats her away. Sister Beast #1 moves to the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie and Coach sprint until Sister Beast #2 BURSTS thro the tunnel walls, stopping Roadie and Coach in their trac Roadie fires his weapon, but it sparks and fizzles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shells are wet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the two Beasts closing in. The men are trapped. Coac looks around, seeing a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab onto ceiling and get out of  water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbing onto the piping along the ceiling, Roadie pulls  himself from the water. Coach uses the machete to cut a p cord from above. He grabs the exposed, sparking end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Heroine) Get out of water!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine sees what he's doing, sprints back the way they c As the two Beasts charge, Coach pulls himself out of the  water by holding onto the above piping. He's forced to wa for Heroine to get out of the water. The second she does, he jams the cord into the water. ZAP! The conductive water sizzles. Sister Beast #1 and Si Beast #2 lock up and crash. ELECTROCUTION. Sparks and smo rises from their cooked bodies. Roadie and Coach look to each other, victorious. They beg shimmying along the piping to the end of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine looks back at the two men. She turns and reenters the basement. GAH! Teen Beast drops in front of her, whacking her to th floor. Heroine slides across the floor, but jumps up quic Teen Beast cautiously moves in for the kill. Heroine raises her weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuck with my family.  (aiming shotgun) I fuck right back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click -- out of ammo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine THROWS the shotgun at him and pulls out the MACHE She rolls left and swings. Teen Beast loses two fingers. She swings again but gets whacked to the floor. Heroine rolls with the hit, grabs her shotgun, and dives  into the KEG ELEVATOR. She slams closed the door as Teen Beast regains its compo and lunges. BAM! It CRASHES against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roadie and Coach crawl to the platform by the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will write stories of your  bravery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's anybody left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men climb up the ladder leading to the ground abo At the top, Roadie pushes off the plywood covering. The t men peer into the night and spot the TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE KEG ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Heroine wedges the door closed. The Beast continues to tr to get in. Heroine bangs the top of the small elevator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send it up! Send it up!

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: Tuffy backs up and hears the screams from the keg elevato

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! She's in the shaft!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer Guy hits the button. The gears grind and start to pu the elevator up to the main floor.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE KEG ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Heroine squirms as the elevator rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it! Move it! Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Teen Beast starts to tear at the base of the rising ke elevator in the shaft, Heroine pounds and tears at the fe planks above her in the keg elevator.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: Beer Guy hits the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ol' Crazy Horse has seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE KEG ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: The elevator SHAKES. Heroine POUNDS a hole through the  elevator top. She tries to squeeze through the SMALL HOLE Teen Beast BITES through the floor board of the keg eleva CLANGGG! The elevator stops. Heroine lurches and grabs th greasy cables to stop her fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It stopped. It fuckin' stopped!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE KEG ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Heroine screams as the elevator shakes. Teen Beast is  struggling to climb right under her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'M ALIVE! OPEN THE DOOR!

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: Tuffy moves for the keg door. Adulterer grabs The Judge f Bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't get in here! We agreed!   They'll get us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can make it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not die because of her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid, drop the gun!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE KEG ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Heroine HACKS at one of the two greasy cables. Teen Beast in the elevator car and RISING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU'RE KILLING HER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll get in! We'll all die!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE KEG ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Heroine almost has the primary cable cut. Teen Beast rise up to bite. SNAP!! The cable BREAKS. Heroine SOARS up the shaft. Teen Beast is pulled down to the bottom. The keg elevator door bursts open on impact. Heroine SLAMS into the ceiling, kicking and yelling.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN BAR
dialogues.text: Tuffy KNOCKS Adulterer's shotgun up, takes the gun, and r open the keg door. Heroine swings out. P.O.V. - Teen Beast is right behind her with mouth open a ready to feed. Tuffy points her shotgun. BLAM! Teen lurches back, dropping back down the shaft. Tuffy slams the keg door shut. Heroine pants on the floor Adulterer is down, winded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F-f-fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Adulterer, rigid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop trying to get people killed. It  is getting very old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer nods, ashamed. Heroine looks around the bar. Sh notices the peanut barrels on top of the bar. Two wooden  planks serve as track, leading straight for the side wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingenuity, baby. Ingenuity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bartender) I need some shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have two left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender expels a shell from The Judge and hands it over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine cringes, eyeing the lined up Molotov cocktails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's prepare ourselves, they ought  to be here with the truck any minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man sips a bottle, still hopped-up on morphine. He l loads his pistol from a pool of bullets on his belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ask me, I'm gonna just lay  right here, wait for sunrise, then  walk on out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your choice, but this is going  to get a whole lot worse before it  gets any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Man shrugs, content with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If all of you run for it, they won't  care about lil ol' me. They like the  food that moves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! Teen Beast's arm ERUPTS through the Boss Man's bel His pistol and bullets scatter across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OHHH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAPPP!!! His head and legs SLAP together as the arm pull him through a small hole in the floor. The group jumps back. Blood rockets out. His body is pure down the tiny hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the tables!!! On the tables!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone struggles to get on the tables. CRASH! Teen Beast's arm reaches up and GRABS Para's  wheelchair, violently shaking it. Para FALLS to the floor Teen Beast's arm grabs Para's leg...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELP ME!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonsai!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo jumps from a table and STOMPS on Teen Beast's arm. H picks up Para and TOSSES him onto a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot potato!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo leaps back onto a table. POP! The power cuts out. Th room goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Settle down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, the shouting and pounding stops. The group nervously shuffles around the tables. There's silence. Dead silence. Then, far is the distance, beyond the walls, a sound is h It's screaming. And it's approaching. Rapidly. The surviv maneuver to peek out the front walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy sees what is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being held by Papa and Momma Beast, Roadie and Coach are  both rushed towards the wall like human battering rams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! The first strike causes the men to HOWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The survivors shake in sickened silence. From beyond the  walls, they can hear high-pitched SCREAMS. THUD! THUD! THUD! With every strike, a splattering of blo spits through the planks of wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wall's coming down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commence Plan B!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire group goes into motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Plan B?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watch the floor and keep the  others safe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! THUD! THUD! With a final furious strike, a few wood planks splinter. Papa Beast sticks in his head and hisses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb's away!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the bar, Beer Guy, Tuffy, and Adulterer release the  first peanut barrel. It's ablaze and sails straight for P Beast. BLAM! It explodes, bursting open the wall and knoc back Papa Beast. The wooden walls go up in flame. Para, on a side table, reaches out and grabs Boss Man's . from the floor. The second peanut barrel is released. It sails outside th breach, but it doesn't explode. Nevertheless, the Beasts  stay far away. Teen Beast madly rips floor boards away, moving towards P table. Teen Beast bursts through the floor, knocking Para the floor. Para crawls to his fallen wheelchair. Teen Beast spots hi moves in to feed. Para points his seat back at the scattered .38 bullets an flips the armrest switch. SNAP! The bullets jump to the p magnet. Para yanks one free, loads the pistol and turns j as Teen Beast strikes... POP! The shot hits Teen Beast in the eye, sending him bac down the hole in the floor. Heroine and Bartender move in. When Teen Beast sticks his head out of the hole again, they thrust both their shotgu into each ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM-BLAM! The two shots scatter head everywhere. The flames in the bar spread, catching the entire wall an roof on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second barrel comes to a stop a good distance from th bar. Suddenly, the top is knocked off. Trampy sticks her  head out. Seeing no trouble, she emerges, dizzy as hell, and races the nearby BEER TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa and Momma Beast both charge the bar. The third peanu barrel is released. It sails for them, but they dive out the way. KABLOOM! It takes out the rest of the wall. Fire and smok fills the place. Adulterer douses Momma Beast with booze as Beer Guy nails her with a lit Molotov cocktail. WHOOSH! Engulfed in flame, she bolts from the bar shrieki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One down, one to go!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa enters and is instantly cornered. He swings wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bartender) Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine and Bartender rip the DEER HEAD from the wall and charge Papa, pinning him against the wall with the antler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo and Beer Guy dive into Papa's legs, holding them dow Tuffy picks up The Judge. WHAM! The shotgun butt knocks out Papa's front teeth. Tuf raises the weapon again, staring down at the monster that killed her child, but Papa Beast gets an arm free to knoc away her fatal blow. Bartender wrenches Papa Beast's arm with all his might. W her hair stuck in Papa Beast's claw, Tuffy is pulled face face with the beast. She squirms as he chomps at her, but with no front teeth, he can't do immediate damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hold him!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy reaches back and shoves her fist into Papa Beast's  mouth, jamming it down his throat. He instantly gags, suc for air. Papa Beast struggles to get free, but the others hold tig Papa Beast's body begins to quiver from a lack of oxygen. His eyes widen, face to face with Tuffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHOKE ON IT!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one last lunge, Papa Beast shakes, his life drifting away. His eyes turn black as his body goes limp. Tuffy pu out her arm from his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to get your number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy shakes her wet arm dry. As the group pulls away, Pa Beast is still pinned to the wall with the deer antlers d into the wood. Heroine turns to Grandma and Grandpa, offering a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you, we're content.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving anyone behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe next time, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine swallows and nods. HONK-HONK-HONK! Just outside t breached wall, the beer truck pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beer truck screeches to a halt. Trampy's at the wheel waving the group over. With the bar burning, a thick laye of SMOKE blankets the entire area. The people amass at the opening, but Heroine stops them f advancing. The group stares the dark night. Silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine eyes the truck, seeing something she likes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She creeps out alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you... come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just smoke. And silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the smoke, a smoldering Momma Beast charges like a b At the truck, Heroine opens the back doors and dives in,  leaving the doors open. Momma Beast gives chase, entering the back.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Heroine is deep into the truck as Momma Beast enters. She advances, hissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and get me you blood-chugging  CUNT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momma howls and charges. Heroine slides out the side keg  door, locking it behind her. Before Momma can see the tra Beer Guy slam closed the rear doors.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Beer Guy latches it. Trampy comes around the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got her? You got her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long, we gotta burn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine looks to the others at the breach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Let's blow this thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others move into action. Beer Guy takes off his shirt and shoves it into the fuel tank. Adulterer and Bozo, wit Para riding piggyback, help. They use the Molotov cocktai to make a fuel trail leading away from the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this lights, run like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About fifteen yards away from the truck. Bozo throws his  silver-plated American Eagle lighter to Heroine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching lighter) Here we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a noise: EOCH-OCK-OCK! EOCK-OCK-OCK! EOCK-OCK-OCK! A deafening pattern of sound erupts from within the truck It's Momma Beast. Again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's calling for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine drops the lighter onto the fuel. It races for the truck. When feet away, COUSIN BEAST lands, stomping out t fire with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fan has officially been buried  in the shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly, another beast, AUNT BEAST, lands on the top of the truck. These Beasts are like the others, but stripped The group gasps. Trampy backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to run --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURST! Trampy's rib cage is ripped from her body. The cul UNCLE BEAST, stands behind her. Her organs drop like a bo of vegetables. Cousin Beast lets out a high-pitched roar. From atop the truck, the rear doors are ripped open. Momm Beast emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to your cars!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beasts spring into action, chasing the group. Bozo, with Para on his back, sprints for his car. Aunt Be RIPS Para from Bozo's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker! Give him back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo runs for his Trans-Am. Para falls to the ground, sti alive. Bozo turns back and sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELLLPPP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo grabs his brother and puts him on his back again, ru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we lost you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para is RIPPED into the air again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You FUCKER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy and Bartender jump into his PICKUP TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Heroine) Get in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine hops in the back. Beer Guy and Adulterer run to a car together. Beer Guy la behind, continually looking over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run and quit looking back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Beer Guy looks forward, Aunt Beast and Uncle Beast hit him HIGH-AND-LOW, cutting him in half. Bozo makes it to h Trans-Am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VAHVVVOOOMMMM! The car roars to life. He pushes in a tape The "MIAMI VICE" theme song blares from the speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me FUCK BIRDS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo peels out. Aunt Beast lands right in his path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! He SMACKS Aunt Beast head on, sending the creature's disemboweled body sailing through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VENGEANCE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para DROPS from the sky, still ALIVE and panting. Cars ar moving everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesussss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The burning JUKEBOX plays a slow love song. Dancing and  holding each other, Grandpa smooches Grandma on the foreh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a good run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para crawls along the ground, being ignored by the Beasts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELP ME! HELP ME SOMEBODY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo turns on his windshield wipers to clear off the bloo and guts. He spots Para.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para claws the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! Hurry! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender jerks the wheel of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para sees Bartender's approaching truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Para rolls right, just missing tires. Para yells for his  brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COME ON! GODDAMN IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo's eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! Para is SMEARED by Adulterer's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overly endearing) I meant to tell you so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remaining cars maneuver to hit the open road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa and Grandma hold each other tight. Uncle Beast en moving to their table. It moves in for the kill. Grandpa kisses his wife gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes, hon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beast OPENS its massive jaws and... CRASH! Bozo's car DRIVES through the bar, SMEARING the Beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU ARE SUCKING MY DICK!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo guns the engine, crashing out the other end of the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo's car veers, flipping over a pile of rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bozo squirms in his flipped car, UPSIDE-DOWN. He hears a Beast approaching. He pulls out a BUTTERFLY KN from the open glove box and SAWS at his safety belt. Cousin Beast leans into the passenger side of the car and looks him right in the eye. Bozo raises the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, if I die, bury me upside down  so the world can KISS MY ASS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Beast leaps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remaining TWO CARS race down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the peddle to the floor, Bartender drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're in the clear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! Momma Beast lands on the roof. She reaches inside an yanks out Bartender's throat. The car veers. Tuffy rights it, leaning over and stomping on the gas. Mo yanks at the door, pulling it open. Tuffy pushes out  Bartender's corpse and JERKS the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK
dialogues.text: Momma Beast falls back, knocking down Heroine. Momma Beas nearly falls out, but manages to grab the rear gate with claw. Defenseless, Heroine backs away. Momma Beast holds tightly, pulling herself onto the bed of the truck. Tuffy stares back through the glass, unable to do anythin Momma Beast lunges towards Heroine. Momma Beast's claw sn Heroine's locket, jerking Heroine right up to the creatur face. The locket catches Momma's attention for split seco Her remaining eye goes from the picture of Charlie to Her Momma's mouth opens wide. Heroine screams! And then, a beam of the RISING SUN catches the gold locke and burns into Momma's eye. In one quick motion, she's go taking the locket with her. Heroine lets out her breath, reaching around her neck for what is no longer there. The truck SKIDS to a halt. Tuffy jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I think --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both jump as Adulterer approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you two all right? They left! We  made it! I think we made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're safe until dark, but we need  to find other people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine rises and moves to the cab of the truck. She find pack of cigs under the visor. Pops in the lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where the IGA grocery store  is over in Red Mountain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, yeah, ten miles west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a bomb shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PING! The lighter springs out, hot. Heroine lights up and passes one to Tuffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll meet in three hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna go home alone... I  don't wanna see what might have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about that. Just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moment of silence as Adulterer and Tuffy look down the  desolate road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about your son. I really  am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy nods, affectionately touching his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you two going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to get my little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car peels off. Adulterer watches the car tear down th road. He glances up at the RISING SUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reading "RED MOUNTAIN" swings lazily in the breeze Tuffy and Heroine coast down a town road. There are rando POOLS OF RED BLOOD in the dirt. No one in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer drives along a small town road. There's no sign life here either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls up to the house. The only sound is the wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine and Tuffy look at each other and proceed with cau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls up in front of his house. The front door is swin open, BANGING against the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine enters the ransacked house. Tuffy follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters his house. It too, is a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look down the stairs to the basement. Nothing. They  move up the stairs to the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: SMACK! They spin to the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves up the stairs to the master bedroom. SMACK! There's a noise at the end of the hall. SMACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cautiously move to the last room in the hall. A  scratched, closed door without an outside handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine kicks in the door and... There's a note on a teddy beer that says, "WE WENT TO THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shudders SMACK against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer holds a shattered PICTURE of his wife and two k He sighs and puts it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines bright in the cloudless sky. There is a st wind that stirs up the dust. Bartender's car slowly lurch up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine and Tuffy skeptically look at the surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right up there, in the back of  the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls up in the back of the store and stops. They get out, looking around. Tuffy holds a machete. Adulterer kneels against his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I just got here. Did  you find your girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's supposed to already be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer shakes his head, acknowledging their death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adulterer sheepishly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is a ghost town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group makes their way to the store front, peeking bey the glass doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, in middle of a dusty parking lot, CHARLI stands staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine runs to her and the others follow. Charlie fidget awkwardly. She cries and blood stains her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Heroine nears, Adulterer GRABS her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! There's something wrong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group eyes Charlie, noticing Heroine's locket around ankle, leading to a slightly ajar manhole cover. Suddenly the sunlight starts to FADE. They look up the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOON moves in front of it -- a SOLAR ECLIPSE. Beast  HISSING and FLUTTERING is heard. Heroine looks from left right, panic stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sunlight is fading. The manhole cover shakes, somethi is holding Charlie in place. Heroine lurches forward, but Adulterer holds her at bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a standstill, the group looks around for options. In t distance, the darkness of the eclipse rolls towards them. Adulterer reacts, grabbing Tuffy's machete and lunging fo Charlie. The strike cuts the chain at her ankle. The manh cover POPS off and a Beast claw sinks into Adulterer. The darkness covers the manhole. Momma Beast rises, hoist Adulterer's blood dripping body from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gurgling blood) Run!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine scoops up her child, moving away from Momma Beast Tuffy grabs them both, leading them back towards the stor front. As Adulterer's blood flows, Momma Beast drags him  towards her main prey.  A blanket of darkness leads Momma Beast, overtaking the  survivors. At the store front, Heroine pulls Charlie clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) I love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A string of ten WHITE VANS come to a halt in the dusty pa lot. THE MAN IN TAN (45, buzz cut, leathery skin, cool) s from the lead van and surveys the ravaged small town. A swarm of men emerge from the other vehicles, all dresse alike in work boots, gas masks and coveralls. They go int action honing in on rubble with SENSORS and COUNTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the damage radius?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TECH (27, horn-rimmed glasses, all business) eyes a lapto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty miles. Red Mountain,  surrounding farms, local TV studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many picked up the broadcast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have figures within the hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man in Tan closes his eyes in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, what's the spin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tornado cluster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the California high desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get what you need to sell it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we have movement!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man in Tan moves to a few men standing over a pool of blood and guts. Using the sensor equipment, the COMPANY M follows the blood trail that enters the grocery store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is torn to hell. Dust and soot hangs in the air The men instinctively raise their high-powered rifles, le the flashlights on the ends lead the way. They follow the trail of blood to a back FREEZER LOCKER. It's scratched, bashed and thrashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Company Man #2 steps forward and uses a metal-cutting cha to cut through the hinges. The door falls with a THUD. As the dust clears, Tuffy, Heroine and Charlie stare back the men, huddled together in a defensive stance. The Man in Tan creaks his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, help them to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine, holding Charlie, lurches back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not safe, she's still alive,  she'll be back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. We know. We're the calvary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man in Tan steps forward, guiding the group out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bulky security truck pulls up. A DRIVER, holding a bloo rag to his nose, gets out and moves to the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver nods to the back of the truck, opening the doo Bozo lurches out, handcuffed and chained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get these cuffs off me! I'm a goddamn  hero for Christ's sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shirtless, irate BOZO sits next to Grandpa and Grandma the back. He settles at the sight of the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for waitin' for me back there,  really fuckin' appreciate it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine covers her daughter's ears as the survivors are h into the truck. Tuffy sits, looking to Bozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you survive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found a new weak spot on 'em, but  it damn ain't pretty getting to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroine, last in the truck, turns to the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you taking us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trauma center. We have doctors  waiting. (off Heroine's pause) You're in good hands now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door shuts on Heroine's concerned face. The Man in Ta locks eyes with the Driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it quick and spread the mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver nods back. Sinister implication understood. The Man in Tan lights a cigarette as he watches the truck drive off. The truck's logo reads, "FARM-AID." He inhales Freeze on him.

dialogues.speaker: LIFE EXPECTANCY
dialogues.text: The Man in Tan exhales a gust of smoke.
